title: Drawing, "Design for a Bronze Candlestick", ca. 1800
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray and brown wash, yellow watercolor on paper lined with paper mount with monogram FR and gilt border
markings: Monogram on the mount: FR (F. Renaud, Lugt 1042).
provenance: F. Renaud (Lugt 1042); Leon Decloux (acquired by l906).
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The design for the candlestick is positioned at the center of the sheet.  The shaft of the candle stick is composed of a winged female figure (the genius of Peace) standing beside a gun barrel, positioned vertically, which supports the socket with a burning candle.  The female figure has the right foot on a staff with a crescent.  A ring of grenades support the base.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Bronze Candlestick", ca. 1800.
ca. 1800. Pen and black ink, brush and gray and brown wash, yellow watercolor on paper lined with paper mount with monogram FR and gilt border. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-204.
